Fake News of Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani Suffering From Pancreatic Cancer And Undergoing Liver Transplant Goes Viral on Social Media, Here is a Fact Check

Recently, several fake news are going viral on social media spreading false information among masses. Similarly, the news of Reliance Chairman Mukesh Ambani suffering from pancreatic cancer has been going viral on Twitter. There are tweets that are being widely shared which says that 'Mukesh Ambani has lost 30 kgs and he has already undergone a liver transplant in London'. People are widely sharing these tweets and asking confirmation on whether they are actual or fake news.

Some messages which are doing the rounds on social media including WhatsApp claim 'Mukesh Ambani has pancreatic cancer and for his surgery done in Sloan Kettering New York. He underwent a liver transplant in London.' There are also tweets which say "Time to consolidate your positions on RIL - news of Ambani's health going bonkers."

LatestLY reached out to the Corporate Communications Team of Reliance Industries who confirmed us that it is fake news. Netizens are therefore urged not to create unnecessary panic in the market by spreading fake news.

Claim:
Reliance Chairman Mukesh Ambani is suffering from pancreatic cancer. There are few tweets which claim that Ambani has lost 30 kgs and he has already undergone a liver transplant in London.

Conclusion:
LatestLY reached out to the Corporate Communications Team of Reliance Industries who confirmed us that it is fake news.

Mukesh Ambani, Asia's richest man, lost almost $7 billion from his net worth as Reliance Industries' shares tumbled the most in over seven months following a drop in quarterly profit. The stock of India's most-valuable company closed 8.6 percent lower in Mumbai on Monday, slipping the most since March 23.

LatestLY urges people not to believe in fake news and to always cross-check facts before forwarding on social media.
title: The claim that Mukesh Ambani is suffering from cancer is not true, neither are there any media reports confirming the same. Earlier too, several such messages have circulated over the internet and they have been debunked by fact-checkers.
vclaim: Social media posts falsely claim that Mukesh Ambani is suffering from pancreatic cancer. Messages circulating online falsely state that Mukesh Ambani has undergone a liver transplant in London and lost 30 kgs. The Corporate Communications Team of Reliance Industries has confirmed that these health-related claims about Mukesh Ambani are fake.
